entries.title: A Rust Belt Bull Market, Fueled By Technology
entries.description: Cutting-edge technology has only started to be applied to long-established industrial areas.

entries.title: Bringing Modernized Kidney Care To The Home: How Monogram Health Is Transforming Polychronic Care
entries.description: Founded and incubated by Frist Cressey Ventures, Monogram Health is on the forefront of transforming the long stagnant kidney care industry, where more than one in seven adults in the U.S. — nearly 37 million people — are living with chronic kidney disease.

entries.title: This Week In Credit Card News: Alarming Credit Card Fraud Statistics; The Rollout Of Amazon’s Buy With Prime
entries.description: What took place this week in the credit card and payment industries

entries.title: As CMS Asks For The Public’s Feedback On Implementing The Inflation Reduction Act, Unresolved Issues Related To Drug Price Negotiations Remain
entries.description: On January 11, CMS announced a timeline for implementation of the IRA's drug pricing provisions, including price negotiations. CMS is enlisting the public’s feedback throughout the process of price negotiations. As CMS asks for the public’s help, several unresolved issues remain.

entries.title: Tesla’s Brand Is Tanking, Survey Finds
entries.description: New research from Morning Consult finds the EV brand’s image has plunged in the months following CEO Elon Musk’s acquisition of Twitter — especially with U.S. adults who identify as Democrats.

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Could Get A MicroLED Display
entries.description: Samsung is preparing microLED displays for its future Galaxy series wearables according to a report.

entries.title: Undisputed Boxing Release Date: Early Access Date And Full Roster Confirmed
entries.description: As announcement trailers go for a sports title, few make as definitive of a statement as Steel City Interactive with Thursday's Undisputed video.

entries.title: New Unidentified Aerial Phenomena Report Adds Hundreds Of New UAP Sightings By Military
entries.description: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) says it has documented over 100 new instances of Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (UAP), or what might have once been called UFOs.

entries.title: 16 Potential Barriers To The Successful Implementation Of Intelligent Automation
entries.description: From the challenge of architecting end-to-end solutions to getting team members on board with new ways of doing things, a business can run up against many obstacles on its intelligent automation journey.

entries.title: India Auto Giant Mahindra Commits To Sibros Connectivity Platform For New Line Of Electric SUVs
entries.description: Six months after unveiling its new Born Electric line of electric SUVs, far-flung, multinational India-based automaker Mahindra and Mahindra is joining a growing number of vehicle manufacturers in adopting a system for over-the-air updates created by Silicon Valley connected tech company Sibros.

entries.title: Only Half Of Tech Firms Comply With California’s Pay Law, Says New Site—But That Number Is Growing Rapidly
entries.description: Comprehensive.io, a new site built by the creator of the popular job cut tracker Layoffs.fyi, scrapes job postings of 700 technology firms from their own career websites, aggregating the salary ranges disclosed and revisiting companies’ career pages each day for new data.

entries.title: How Longer Life Expectancies Will Change What It Means To Age
entries.description: How would a dramatically protracted/extended life span change what it means to be human? Answer by Lawrence Kosick, President and Co-Founder at GetSetUp.

entries.title: G2 Esports, Jeris Johnson And Theresa Jarvis Drop Bombastic 2023 Anthem
entries.description: G2 Esports' typically confident second foray into annual team anthems aims to fire a warning shot at its competition.

entries.title: The Hidden Consequences Of The Plastic Pollution Crisis
entries.description: Plastic is everywhere, in the water we drink, in the air, in the food we eat.

entries.title: C-Suite Leaders Feel Good, Despite The Davos Agenda
entries.description: Let the Davos crowd debate all that's wrong in the world. CIOs and their C-suite peers are feeling good.

entries.title: A Psychologist Offers 5 Healthy Habits To Improve Your Self-Esteem
entries.description: Don’t ever feel like your self-doubt can’t be conquered. It can.

entries.title: Trends That Defined The Health Tech Space In 2022
entries.description: After being enhanced with the data from billions of patient cases, healthcare multiplied by technology will have a massive transformational impact.

entries.title: ‘The Last Of Us’ Is Reviewing Better Than All These Classic HBO Shows
entries.description: ‘The Last Of Us’ Is Reviewing Better Than All These Classic HBO Shows The Last of Us now has racked up a sizable 69 reviews, which have brought its total to a 97% critic score on Rotten Tomatoes.

entries.title: Why It’s Time To Bring Security In Line With Organizational KPIs
entries.description: Introducing strong KPIs around cybersecurity will help to operationalize activity, bringing security in line with other business processes that have long been defined by benchmarks and targets.

entries.title: You Want The Next Big Trend? It’s Artificial Intelligence In Crypto
entries.description: There’s an untapped potential we’re only just beginning to see put to use.

entries.title: Driving SaaS Growth From The Intersection Of Marketing-Led And Product-Led Growth Strategies
entries.description: Which growth strategy should you bank on? I say none. In this article, I make a case for the intersection of MLG and PLG, which is what I follow at Vervotech—a bootstrapped and profitable SaaS company.

entries.title: Are You Ready For Cybersecurity Mesh?
entries.description: The result is reduced administration complexity, fewer mistakes, increased visibility and a better coordinated, automated response in real time. Moreover, the tools can be updated and administered from a central plane.

entries.title: Ubisoft May Need A Massive Hit Soon, Or Else
entries.description: Yesterday was a bleak day for Ubisoft, a major game publisher that is increasingly looking like it may be on the brink.

entries.title: How ChatGPT Will Forever Change Customer Expectations
entries.description: The widespread use, growing popularity, and self-evident power of ChatGPT and similar technologies will feed into consumer expectations of all technology.

entries.title: The Cultural Impact Of 235 Million Leaked Twitter Users Email Addresses
entries.description: An Israeli cybersecurity firm claims that hackers obtained the email addresses of more than 235 million Twitter users on a popular underground marketplace. This could create a plethora of problems for the social media platform where Black adults comprise its largest ethnic group at 29%.

entries.title: The Real-Time AI Data Race Is On
entries.description: We don’t just need more intelligence, we need it according to specific vectors. Key among those vectors are AI at scale, AI that is validated, secured and bias-free (aka explainable AI) and AI engines that are capable of computation analysis in real-time.

entries.title: Monique Woodard Unveils Cake Ventures, New $17 Million Fund Focused On ‘Demographic Change’
entries.description: The Black founder-turned-investor will write $500,000 seed and pre-seed checks, backed by investors including Bank of America and billionaire Melinda French Gates.

entries.title: What's In Store For The Data Center Industry In 2023?
entries.description: This year, I believe we will see more flexibility in cloud computing, faster speeds and higher capacity networks and data centers, as well as data centers moving more power backup and generation onsite with a vision of becoming regenerative.

entries.title: How Bayer Is Unleashing Creativity—and Breaking Taboos—in Consumer Healthcare
entries.description: Patricia Corsi, Chief Marketing and IT Officer at Bayer Consumer Health, reveals the playbook she follows to shake up the traditional agency-client model and break through the white noise of an oversaturated marketing world.

entries.title: Marvel Snap's Monetization Has Become Just Hilariously Stupid
entries.description: A couple months ago, I was the biggest defender of Marvel Snap’s refreshing approach to monetization, which did not rely on gacha-like card packs like most CCGs, and cards were earned through constant play and an achievable Collection Level system.

entries.title: Four Steps To Bringing Your IT Estate Into Focus
entries.description: Although this year may offer up plenty of challenges related to IT forecasting and budgeting, four steps can provide the appropriate focus needed to strengthen your IT estate and foster opportunities for innovation.

entries.title: How Zero-Shot Learning Turbocharges Conversational AI
entries.description: Simply put, ZSL is the method by which a machine learning (ML) model can recognize an object or complete a task without having come across it before.

entries.title: ‘Starfield,’ With No Release Date, Will Get Its Own Showcase, Also With No Release Date
entries.description: One, however, is missing. That would be Starfield, and Bethesda was quick to come out to say that the reason Starfield wouldn’t be at the showcase was that it would eventually get its own dedicated showcase.

entries.title: Why Combatting Social Engineering Attacks Requires A Team Sport Approach
entries.description: Embracing a team sport philosophy unlocks strength in numbers through universal alignment across the hybrid attack surface, paving clear pathways to a stronger security posture that enables organizations to work protected.

entries.title: ‘Destiny 2’ Is Starting To Feel Increasingly Broken Over Time
entries.description: Yesterday, Bungie uploaded a new patch to Destiny 2 that was seemingly pretty minor, but it’s had pretty big ramifications for the larger game, it seems.

entries.title: ‘Outrageous Conflict Of Interest’: The World's Biggest Climate Summit Just Named An Oil Exec To Run It
entries.description: The UAE named the chief executive of state-owned oil giant ADNOC, one of the biggest oil companies in the world, to lead the global climate talks.

entries.title: Debunking Those Bonehead Claims About Being Able To Use Special-Purpose AI To Readily Spot Generative AI ChatGPT Produced Essays, Plus Caustic Call-Outs By AI Ethics And AI Law
entries.description: A rising claim is that special-purpose AI apps can be devised to figure out whether a set of text is produced by human hand versus generative AI such as ChatGPT. These are misleading and a false hope. Here's what you need to know.

entries.title: NAPA Rolls Out Electrified Vehicle Service Training Program
entries.description: As demand for service technicans skilled in working on electrified vehicles rises, NAPA has created a training program to create a network of qualified service centers.

entries.title: The CIO's Role On The Journey From IT To The Digital Transformation Area In Today's Company
entries.description: The natural evolution leads us to consider an area of digital transformation that can help promote a change in the model in order to promote maximum integration in the business and business processes.

entries.title: ‘Escape From Tarkov’ Competition Has Fans Creating Ads For The Game’s War-Torn Locations
entries.description: Fans are flexing their creative muscles in addition to their trigger fingers.

entries.title: Why Vaccine Reluctancy May Be The Biggest Threat To Your Child’s Wellbeing
entries.description: The growing skepticism and cynicism with respect to vaccines is a serious problem and will continue to get worse if scientists, health care professionals, and public policy experts don’t act fast.

entries.title: How To Unlock Higher Returns On Data Through AI
entries.description: The value of data within the modern enterprise is growing exponentially with the advent of new AI models and other solutions. Companies should look closely at where data and AI can deliver the most value within their businesses in 2023 and work toward achieving higher returns.

entries.title: Apple AirPods Lite For $99 Coming Soon, New Leak Claims
entries.description: Low-cost AirPods are going to be a thing, according to a report from the reliable Ming-Chi Kuo.

entries.title: 3 Predictions For Divergent Quantum Tracks In 2023
entries.description: Taking stock of where the world is in terms of quantum information science and technology, here are three predictions for divergent quantum tracks in 2023.

entries.title: European Automakers Face Hurdles In 2023 As China Threat Looms
entries.description: The European automotive industry faces a challenging year. Experts worry a recession might be more than just mild, there could be factory closures or market volatility and challenges. Most expect the threat from China imports will be formidable, particularly with its electric cars.

entries.title: Is Your Data And Analytics Organization Recession-Proof?
entries.description: If you’ve prepared your team using these ten tips, you’ll be better equipped to navigate any economic environment—contracting or expanding. Data organizations that are scrappy, collaborative and agile will always be the ones most sought after.

entries.title: Wendy's Cooks Up New Experiences With AI, Cloud And Edge Computing
entries.description: Wendy's new restaurant design standard, Global Next Gen, use AI, edge computing and a new optimized layout to deliver more convenience, speed, and accuracy for its customers and delivery partners.

entries.title: Why SEC Regulations Could Drive A 'Great Reshuffle' Among Advisor Talent In Financial Services
entries.description: Advisors have more opportunities than ever before to attract, retain and do great work for clients. The big question is, will their firms allow them to leverage the right digital tools at their disposal?

entries.title: How To Build A Network Of Security Champions In Your Organization
entries.description: When you have security champions on your side, the ongoing fight against hackers is a more even match.

entries.title: Metaverse Applications In The Real World
entries.description: As the world continues to talk about the metaverse, there is a lot of curiosity about it and how it will be used in the real world.

entries.title: Living Close To An Airport Puts Children At A Higher Risk Of Lead Exposure
entries.description: A recent study that was conducted in California found that children who live in close proximity to an airport have at least 21% higher lead levels in their blood.

entries.title: Is Your Vendor Management Process Keeping Up With Changing Business Models?
entries.description: Just as the vendors themselves need to stay ahead of the curve to remain relevant, buyers must realize that waiting two to three years to review their tech stack will inevitably leave them behind their competitors regarding innovation.

entries.description: To find out what’s really going on, examine the changes hiring managers have endured over the last several years.

entries.description: A new study shows immigrants produce a significant percentage of innovations in America and make U.S. natives more inventive.

entries.title: Corrupt Power Sector Strangles South Africa
entries.description: South Africa used to have a well-functioning energy sector, the envy of Africa, but Eskom’s poor performance is now a problem for all the country’s residents and the South African economy.

entries.title: Astell&Kern Unveils High-End ACRO CA1000T Desktop Audio System
entries.description: The new ACRO CA1000T from Astell&Kern provides everything a hi-fi enthusiast needs to build a complete head-Fi system by offering XLR and RCA outputs, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth in one luxury device with the latest ESS flagship Dual DAC and Dual Tube Triple Amp System.

entries.title: NASA Finds Second Earth-Size World Around A Nearby Star
entries.description: Scientists have found another Earth-size world called TOI 700 e orbiting within the "habitable zone" of a star just 100 light-years from the solar system.

entries.title: Microsoft Launches Imagine Cup Junior 2023 Empowering Top Innovations
entries.description: Imagine Cup Junior (ICJ) 2023 is open for registration creating outstanding paths for students to learn about technology solving world’s biggest challenges.
